content: I wanted to request backporting the compiler_builtins bump from 0.1.66 to 0.1.67 (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93436) to 1.59 beta if possible. I know we're close to the deadline... It's just picking up a small fix to fix staticlib targets for an Android target I need.
that seems fine to me -- cc @T-libs

not sure how much correlation/overlap, but a few days ago a backport to stable was approved for compiler_builtins to fix #92897
(just FIY in case it helps)
Is there somewhere I can monitor the progress for backporting https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93436 into 1.59 beta? Looks like the merge hasn't happened yet.

It'll likely get discussed on Wednesday (T-libs meeting) or Thursday (T-compiler) meeting to either be rejected or approved for backport, and then the backport will either happen ~Friday or as part of promotion on ~Monday
Would be nice if we could handle approvals like this async sometimes, to give ourselves more time.
Doesn't seem like there are any libs objections.
(any team should be more than fine to just mark as beta-accepted earlier; I know compiler sometimes unilaterally approves and in some cases I will do that close to the release date too)
